claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.

extracted_evidence.quote: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1 N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3 N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok contains 45 mcg of hemagglutinin (HA) per strain, supporting the first part of the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: Across three clinical trials (Studies 2 – 4, Tables 2 and 3) a total of 2050 adults age 50 years and older received Flublok and 2048 received a U.S.-licensed trivalent in activated influenza vaccine (IIV3) comparator.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote establishes that the comparator in the studies is a standard-dose influenza vaccine, which is relevant for comparing HA content per strain.

extracted_evidence.quote: Data for Flublok Quad rival ent are relevant to Flublok because both vaccines ar manufactured using the same process and have overlapping compositions.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote supports the relevance of data about Flublok and its quadrivalent version, which is important for understanding the HA content per strain.

extracted_evidence.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote indicates that Flublok's formulation, including HA content, follows official standards, supporting the accuracy of the stated HA amount.
